summary_points: 1. In March 2025, Nucor issued $1 billion in notes (4.650% due 2030 and 5.100% due 2035), receiving net proceeds of $997 million after capitalizing and amortizing $9 million in issuance costs.
2. Nucor amended its revolving credit facility in March 2025, increasing borrowing capacity from $1.75 billion to $2.25 billion and extending maturity to March 11, 2030.
3.  The net proceeds from the March 2025 note issuance were used to redeem $1 billion in outstanding 2.000% and 3.950% notes due 2025.
1. Domino's Pizza Inc. subsidiaries issued $1 billion in senior secured notes on August 12, 2025, with maturities of 5 and 7 years.
2. The notes were sold in an offering exempt from registration, with the closing anticipated for September 5, 2025.
3.  The filing includes numerous representations and warranties from Domino's, covering aspects of its financial health, legal compliance, and business operations as of August 12, 2025.
1. Wynn Macau issued $1 billion in senior notes on August 19th, 2025, receiving net proceeds of $989 million.
2. The offering was slightly undersubscribed, resulting in an $11 million shortfall.
3. A change of control provision exists; if Wynn Resorts' ownership in Wynn Resorts (Macau) falls below 60%, noteholders can demand repurchase.
1. Fiserv Inc. entered into a new $8 billion senior unsecured revolving credit facility maturing August 12, 2030, replacing a prior $6 billion facility.
2.  The new credit facility increases the maximum aggregate principal amount available by $2 billion compared to the previous agreement.

3.  The new credit agreement includes covenants restricting consolidated indebtedness to no more than 3.75 times consolidated EBITDA, triggering immediate repayment if breached or in the event of bankruptcy proceedings.
1. Lindsey Caplan, CBRE Group, Inc.'s Chief Accounting Officer, will resign on August 31, 2025, and leave the company entirely on December 31, 2025.
2. Andrew Horn, the company's Deputy Chief Financial Officer, will become the principal accounting officer on September 1, 2025.
3. There are no special arrangements or family relationships involved in Andrew Horn's appointment as principal accounting officer.
